title: 103_hr2040
content: The Act may be cited as the "Commission on the Dual-Use Application of Facilities and Resources at White Sands Missile Range Act". Congress finds that the end of the Cold War allows for a reduction in defense spending, creating an opportunity to utilize defense-related equipment in the private sector for economic growth and job creation. The Department of Defense has invested in research and development of such technologies, including those at White Sands Missile Range, but lacks guidance on their utilization. The establishment of a commission to study defense-related facilities, equipment, processes, and technologies at White Sands Missile Range will provide valuable information on their potential dual-use applications by the private sector. The establishment of a commission to study defense-related facilities, equipment, processes, and technologies at White Sands Missile Range will provide valuable information on their potential dual-use applications by the private sector. SEC. 3. ESTABLISHMENT OF COMMISSION. The Commission on the Dual-Use Application of Facilities and Resources at White Sands Missile Range is established with 10 members appointed by the Secretary of Defense, including individuals with experience in cooperative research and development agreements and dual-use technologies. The Commission on the Dual-Use Application of Facilities and Resources at White Sands Missile Range is established with 10 members appointed by the Secretary of Defense, including individuals with experience in cooperative research and development agreements and dual-use technologies. Members shall be appointed for the life of the Commission, with any vacancies filled in the same manner as the original appointment. Six members constitute a quorum, and the Commission shall select a Chairman from among its members. The Commission shall hold its first meeting within 30 days of all members being appointed and terminate 1 year after the date of full appointment. The Commission on the Dual-Use Application of Facilities and Resources at White Sands Missile Range will conduct a study on how defense-related equipment can be utilized by the private sector. A report with detailed findings and recommendations will be submitted to the Committees on Armed Services and Appropriations within 1 year. The Commission also has powers outlined in Section 5. The Commission, under Section 5, has the power to hold hearings, gather information from federal agencies, delegate powers, and use the postal service. Additionally, Section 6 addresses personnel matters within the Commission. The Commission members are compensated based on their status as officers or employees of the United States, with daily rates not exceeding level IV of the Executive Schedule. They are also provided travel expenses while on duty. The Commission appoints an executive director with a specified compensation rate. The Commission appoints an executive director who can hire additional personnel as needed. Service on the Commission or employment by the Commission does not conflict with federal laws on conflicts of interest. The Commission appoints an executive director who can hire additional personnel as needed, without conflicting with federal laws on conflicts of interest. Appointive or elective positions in the Government are subject to specific provisions of Federal law. Authorization of appropriations is granted to carry out the purposes of this Act.
